item.title: Some on left 2 racks next to our home, 7th December
item.description:
Someone left 2 racks next to our home. We are doing refrub work in the property. There is rubbish on our front door and some one took that as an opportunity to leave their unwanted item next to us

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brimpsfield Close, Abbey Wood
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abdomen truck parked illegally on a busy road, 7th December
item.description:
A white ford truck, number plate CU18 VUT has been parked illegally on double yellow lines for more than 24 hours. This is very dangerous and causing lots of unnecessary congestion and encouraging other cars to park illegally on double yellow lines. This is a repeated occurrence on this road and there are never any traffic wardens to enforce the parking restrictions. It looks like the vehicle has been abandoned.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eden Park Avenue, Eden Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Muddy pathway, 7th December
item.description:
There was lots of gas works done in my communal block of flats, the pathways were gug up to carry out the works They have been filled in but have been left in a filthy muddy mess , the whole pathway leading to my front door is full of mud Is it possible the council can clean the pathway, the dirt gets all walked into the propertys ofvthe residents and I have carpet and I've had to clean it s couple of times at my front door Also I'm a cancer patient and keeping clean is very big priority for my home Thankyou if someone could have a look and solve the problem Maryt645@icloud.com
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kingsground, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti on the walls of Energie fitness, 7th December
item.description:
We have had 2 different occasions of graffiti being done on the walls of energie fitness Eltham. The first time (sprayed red) was done early last week, with the white spray being done within the last 48 hours. Please can this be removed ASAP.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Tom Coombs Close, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement in very poor state of repair, 7th December
item.description:
The pavement of the Balham high road in central Balham is in a very poor state. There’s a huge number of broken and loose paving slabs - that move and represent a real trip hazard. It’s bad from the junction with old Devonshire Road all the way down to Balham Station Road My elderly mother recently tripped on one of the lose slabs near to the Trinity Hospice shop. Thankfulky she regained her balance as otherwise could have seriously hurt herself.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 91, Balham High Road, Balham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
